title: National POW/MIA Recognition Day, 2025
summary: The document is a presidential proclamation declaring September 19, 2025, as National POW/MIA Recognition Day. It honors the courage and sacrifices of American prisoners of war (POWs) and those missing in action (MIA), highlighting their enduring resilience and the ongoing efforts to account for over 80,000 missing service members. The proclamation also commemorates the repatriation of remains from North Korea and underscores the commitment to continue this mission. The President calls for nationwide observance of the day through ceremonies and activities, emphasizing the nation's unwavering commitment to leaving no one behind.
